p: Another well-established network property is closure, the tendency for nodes to form edges with their network partners’ partners [ 37, 39]. This redundancy helps to improve the accuracy of social learning and ensure the resiliency of cultural adaptation if nodes are removed from the network [ 53, 54]. In the context of social learning, prestige predicts more triangles than a random network because people are likely to learn from their teacher’s teacher, with an increased chance for every teacher that the node and the teacher’s teacher have in common (Hypothesis 1d, Fig 1) [ 38]. In ERGMs, we test for these types of triangles with a geometrically weighted edgewise shared partners, outgoing two-path (GWESP-OTP) term [ 37, 38].
